snippet: Foursquare, a start-up whose app lets users share their locations, has seen its growth slow, and its founders hope that suggesting places to users could change that.
abstract: Foursquare, a start-up whose app lets users share their locations with friends, has seen its growth slow, and its founders hope that suggesting places to users could change that; it is overhauling its app, turning it into a recommendation service that could rival sites like Yelp; its efforts show the difficulty for start-ups to sustain their early momentum and chart a course to mass-market success in a rapidly changing industry.
lead_paragraph: Foursquare, a start-up whose app lets users share their locations, has seen its growth slow, and its founders hope that suggesting places to users could change that.

headline.seo: In App Overhaul, Foursquare Shifts to Recommendations
headline.main: Rather Than Share Your Location, Foursquare Wants to Suggest One
headline.print_headline: Rather Than Share Your Location, Foursquare Wants to Suggest One
